What is the purpose of the `invalidateblock` command if it only temporarily marks a block as invalid?

The `invalidateblock` command does not temporarily mark a block as invalid, it permanently marks a block as invalid, as if it violated a consensus rule. This means that once a block is marked as invalid using this command, it will remain invalid.

invalidateblock "hash"

Permanently marks a block as invalid, as if it violated a consensus rule.

Arguments:
1. hash  (string, required) the hash of the block to mark as invalid

Result:

Examples:
> verus invalidateblock "blockhash"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "invalidateblock", "params": ["blockhash"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
